medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began suddenly upon waking this AM, lasting for 12 hours. Initially located in the periumbilical area but now radiated to the right lower quadrant (RLQ). Reports one episode of emesis and anorexia; denies fever, chills, diarrhea, and urinary symptoms. Pain is reproducible with right lower extremity extension and involves positive psoas sign.
